standard_metadata.standard_description: Recognize angles as geometric shapes that are formed wherever two rays share a common endpoint, and understand concepts of angle measurement:

question.content: **Which of these angles has a measure of $270^\circ?$**

images.alt: An angle that shows a little more than a half turn.
An angle that shows a little less than an eighth of a turn.
An angle that shows exactly a half turn.
An angle that shows about a three-fourths turn.

hints.content: We can identify a $180^\circ$ angle.  It looks like a straight line.      [[☃ image 1]]  The $270^\circ$ angle will have to be larger than that one.

images.alt: An angle that shows exactly a half turn.

hints.content: This angle is a $270^\circ$ angle.     [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: An angle that shows about a three-fourths turn.

question.content: **Which of these angles has a measure of $90^\circ?$**

images.alt: An angle that shows about a third of a turn.
An angle that shows a little less than a fourth of a turn.
An angle that shows about an eighth of a turn.
An angle that shows exactly a one-fourth of a turn.

hints.content: We can identify a $90^\circ$ angle.  It looks like the corner of a rectangular piece of paper or a door.    [[☃ image 1]]  A $90^\circ$ angle can be turned in any direction.

images.alt: Two lines create a right angle.

hints.content: This angle is a $90^\circ$ angle.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: An angle that shows exactly a one-fourth of a turn.

question.content: **Which of these angles has a measure of $45^\circ?$**

images.alt: An angle that shows about a one-fourth of a turn.
An angle that shows exactly a half turn.
An angle that shows exactly a one-fourth of a turn.
An angle that shows about an eighth of a turn.

hints.content: We can identify a $90^\circ$ angle.  It looks like the corner of a rectangular piece of paper or a door.    [[☃ image 1]]  The $45^\circ$ angle will have to be smaller than that one.

images.alt: Two lines create a right angle.

hints.content: The smallest angle pictured is a $45^\circ$ angle.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: An angle that shows about an eighth of a turn.

question.content: **Which of these angles has a measure of $135^\circ?$**

images.alt: An angle that shows a little more than a third of a turn.
An angle that shows about an eighth of a turn.
An angle that shows a little more than a three-fourths of a turn.
An angle that shows exactly a one-fourth of a turn.

hints.content: We can identify a $90^\circ$ angle.  It looks like the corner of a rectangular piece of paper or a door.    [[☃ image 1]]  The $135^\circ$ angle will have to be larger than that one.

images.alt: Two lines create a right angle.

hints.content: This angle is a $135^\circ$ angle.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: An angle that shows a little more than a third of a turn.

question.content: **Which of these angles has a measure of $60^\circ?$**

images.alt: An angle that shows a little less than a half of a turn.
An angle that shows exactly a half of a turn.
An angle that shows a little less than an eighth of a turn.
An angle that shows about a sixth of a turn.

hints.content: We can identify a $90^\circ$ angle.  It looks like the corner of a rectangular piece of paper or a door.    [[☃ image 1]]  The $60^\circ$ angle will have to be smaller than that one.

images.alt: Two lines create a right angle.

hints.content: This angle is a $60^\circ$ angle.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: An angle that shows about a sixth of a turn.

question.content: **Which image shows a marked angle that measures $90^\circ?$**

images.alt: A three-sided shape with an arrow pointing to the angle made by the left corner that is about a one-sixth of a turn.
A five-sided shape with an arrow pointing to the angle made by the bottom left corner that is a little more than a one-fourth of a turn.
A four-sided shape with an arrow pointing to the angle made by the upper left corner that is about a  one-fourth of a turn.

hints.content: A $90^\circ$ angle looks like the corner of a rectangular piece of paper or a door.  Sometimes, it is marked with a little square inside of the angle.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two lines create a right angle.

hints.content: This is the shape with a marked angle that measures $90^\circ$.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A four-sided shape with an arrow pointing to the angle made by the upper left corner that is about a one-fourth of a turn.

question.content: **Which image shows a marked angle that measures $120^\circ?$**

images.alt: A six-sided shape with an arrow pointing to the angle made by the bottom left corner that is about a one-third of a turn.
A three-sided shape with an arrow pointing to the angle made by the left corner that is about a one-sixth of a turn.
A five-sided shape with an arrow pointing to the angle made by the bottom left corner that is a little more than a one-fourth of a turn.

hints.content: A $90^\circ$ angle looks like the corner of a rectangular piece of paper or a door.  Sometimes, it is marked with a little square inside of the angle.  [[☃ image 1]]  The $120^\circ$ angle will have to be larger than that one.

images.alt: Two lines create a right angle.

hints.content: This is the shape with a marked angle that measures $120^\circ$.     [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A six-sided shape with an arrow pointing to the angle made by the bottom left corner that is about a one-third of a turn.

question.content: **Which image shows a marked angle that measures $60^\circ?$**

images.alt: A five-sided shape with an arrow pointing to the angle made by the top right corner that is a little more than a one-fourth of a turn.
A four-sided shape with an arrow pointing to the angle made by the upper left corner that is about a one-fourth of a turn.
A three-sided shape with an arrow pointing to the angle made by the left corner that is about a one-sixth of a turn.

hints.content: A $90^\circ$ angle looks like the corner of a rectangular piece of paper or a door.  Sometimes, it is marked with a little square inside of the angle.  [[☃ image 1]]  The $60^\circ$ angle will have to be smaller than that one.

images.alt: Two lines create a right angle.

hints.content: This is the shape with a marked angle that measures $60^\circ$.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A three-sided shape with an arrow pointing to the angle made by the left corner that is about a one-sixth of a turn.

question.content: **Which of these is closest to the measure of the angle?**

images.alt: An angle that shows about a sixth of a turn.

hints.content: We can most easily identify a $90^\circ$ angle.  It looks like the corner of a rectangular piece of paper or a door.    [[☃ image 1]]  Does the angle in this problem look square like a $90^\circ$ angle?

images.alt: Two lines create a right angle.

hints.content: The angle is smaller than a $90^\circ$ angle. The only answer choice that is smaller than $90^\circ$ is $60^\circ$.
The measure of the angle is $60^\circ$.

question.content: **Which of these is closest to the measure of the angle?**

images.alt: An angle that shows exactly one-fourth of a turn.

hints.content: We can most easily identify a $90^\circ$ angle.  It looks like the corner of a rectangular piece of paper or a door.    [[☃ image 1]]  Does the angle in this problem look square like a $90^\circ$ angle?

images.alt: Two lines create a right angle.

hints.content: We often see a square marking on $90^\circ$ angles to indicate that they are right angles.  When we see this, we can assume that the measure of the angle is $90^\circ$.
The measure of the angle is $90^\circ$.

question.content: **Which of these is closest to the measure of the angle?**

images.alt: An angle that shows a little less than an eighth of a turn.

hints.content: We can most easily identify a $90^\circ$ angle.  It looks like the corner of a rectangular piece of paper or a door.    [[☃ image 1]]  Does the angle in this problem look square like a $90^\circ$ angle?

images.alt: Two lines create a right angle.

hints.content: The angle looks smaller than a $90^\circ$ angle. The only answer choice that is smaller than $90^\circ$ is $30^\circ$.
The measure of the angle is $30^\circ$.

question.content: **Which of these is closest to the measure of the angle?**

images.alt: An angle that shows a little more than a third of a turn.

hints.content: We can most easily identify a $90^\circ$ angle.  It looks like the corner of a rectangular piece of paper or a door.    [[☃ image 1]]  Does the angle in this problem look square like a $90^\circ$ angle?

images.alt: Two lines create a right angle.

hints.content: The angle looks larger than $90^\circ$.  A $180^\circ$ angle is twice the size of a $90^\circ$ angle.  It is called a *straight angle* and happens when one side of the angle rotates around to point in the opposite direction of the other side.  It looks like this:    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two lines create a straight angle.

hints.content: The angle looks bigger than a $90^\circ$ angle and smaller than a $180^\circ$ angle.  What angle could that be?
The measure of the angle is $135^\circ$.

question.content: **Which of these is closest to the measure of the angle?**

images.alt: An angle that shows exactly a half of a turn.

hints.content: We can most easily identify a $90^\circ$ angle.  It looks like the corner of a rectangular piece of paper or a door.    [[☃ image 1]]  Does the angle in this problem look square like a $90^\circ$ angle?

images.alt: Two lines create a right angle.

hints.content: A $180^\circ$ angle is twice the size of a $90^\circ$ angle.  It is called a *straight angle* and happens when one side of the angle rotates around to point in the opposite direction of the other side.  It looks like this:    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two lines create a straight angle.

hints.content: The measure of the angle is $180^\circ$.

question.content: **Which of these is closest to the measure of the angle?**

images.alt: An angle that shows about a three-fourths turn.

hints.content: We can identify a $180^\circ$ angle.  It looks like a straight line.    [[☃ image 1]]  The $270^\circ$ angle will have to be larger than that one.

images.alt: Two lines create a straight angle.

hints.content: The measure of the angle is $270^\circ$.

question.content: **Which is closest to the measure of the marked angle in the shape?**

images.alt: A four-sided shape with an arrow pointing to the angle made by the bottom left corner that is larger than one-eighth of a turn but smaller than one-fourth of a turn.

hints.content: We can most easily identify a $90^\circ$ angle.  It looks like the corner of a rectangular piece of paper or a door.     [[☃ image 1]]  Does the angle in this problem look square like a $90^\circ$ angle?

images.alt: Two lines create a right angle.

hints.content: The angle is a little smaller than a $90^\circ$ angle.   Which choice is a little smaller than $90^\circ$?
The measure of the angle is $60^\circ$.

question.content: **Which is closest to the measure of the marked angle in the shape?**

images.alt: A four-sided shape with an arrow pointing to the angle made by the bottom left corner that is about a one-third of a turn.

hints.content: We can most easily identify a $90^\circ$ angle.  It looks like the corner of a rectangular piece of paper or a door.    [[☃ image 1]]  Does the angle in this problem look square like a $90^\circ$ angle?

images.alt: Two lines create a right angle.

hints.content: The angle looks larger than $90^\circ$.  A $180^\circ$ angle is twice the size of a $90^\circ$ angle.  It is called a *straight angle* and happens when one side of the angle rotates around to point in the opposite direction of the other side.  It looks like this:    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: Two lines create a straight angle.

hints.content: The angle looks bigger than a $90^\circ$ angle and smaller than a $180^\circ$ angle.  What angle could that be?
The measure of the angle is about $135^\circ$.

question.content: **Match these angles with their measures.**

hints.content: Let's arrange the angles from smallest to largest.
The smallest angle is $30^\circ$, next is $60^\circ$, next is $90^\circ$, and the largest is $180^\circ$.

images.alt: An angle that shows a little less than an eighth of a turn.
An angle that shows about a sixth of a turn.
An angle that shows exactly a one-fourth of a turn.
An angle that shows exactly a half turn.

hints.content: Now, let's match them in the table.  Measure | Angle - | - | - $30^\circ$ |  $180^\circ$ |  $60^\circ$ |    $90^\circ$ |

images.alt: An angle that shows a little less than an eighth of a turn.
An angle that shows exactly a half turn.
An angle that shows about a sixth of a turn.
An angle that shows exactly a one-fourth of a turn.
